title: Magazine Article, "Gustav Jensen, 288 Lexington Avenue, New York", December 1937
description: The present four-page article by William N. Connor appeared in "People," Shelf Appeal magazine. The text is illustrated by photographs of Jensen designs: a doorknob for the Jensen studio; a Bell telephone; the Adrienne cosmetics line; a container for a rug for the Karagheusin Corporation; the Morrell meat packs; a Goodrich tire design; a radio set; a metal sink for International Nickel Co.; and a cosmetic jar for the Bakelite Corporation. An illustration of "Hannibal," probably excerpted from The History of Rome project, is reproduced on the article's cover page.

tombstone.epitaph: Magazine Article, "Gustav Jensen, 288 Lexington Avenue, New York", December 1937.30 x 25.2 cm (11 7/8 x 9 in.). Gift of Ellen Gustav Jensen. 1956-47-58.
